question: What keyword is used to declare an interface in Java?
Can a Java interface contain method bodies?

options.b: No, in all versions except Java 8 and above
options.c: Yes, but only in Java 9 and above

correct_answer: No, in all versions except Java 8 and above

question: What is the maximum number of different types a Java interface can have as of the latest versions?
What must a Java class do if it implements an interface?

options.a: Implement all of the interface's non-default methods
options.b: Implement at least one non-default method
options.c: Implement all of the interface's default methods

correct_answer: Implement all of the interface's non-default methods

question: Can a Java class have multiple base classes?

options.c: No, Java only supports single inheritance
options.d: Yes, but only if the classes are interfaces

question: What feature of Java interfaces allows them to simulate multiple inheritance?
If an object implements the interface 'Comparable', what can it guarantee about the object?
Which of the following is a benefit of using interfaces in Java?

options.a: They allow objects to be instantiated directly
options.c: They allow objects to be used interchangeably based on implemented interfaces
options.d: They provide a way to implement multiple classes

correct_answer: They allow objects to be used interchangeably based on implemented interfaces

question: Starting with which version of Java were default methods allowed in interfaces?
What type of methods can be declared in a Java interface from Java 9 onwards?
